intro: Pentatropis novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea pentatropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
